author: K C
text:
“I have taken a bold step and I am ready to face the consequences. I only want justice for my daughter,” says the mother of a woman, who was allegedly raped by Madhukar Angur, founder-chancellor of a private university here. She filed a complaint against Angur, a relative of hers, on Friday night, saying her daughter had been subjected to the trauma for four years till 2014 while she was employed at the university.

Speaking to The Hindu on Sunday, the woman said her daughter had started developing symptoms of obsessive compulsive disorder two years ago, but the sexual assault was revealed only this January after she underwent the latest of several rounds of treatment.

Charge denied

She denied allegations that a property dispute was the reason for filing the complaint. The victim had taken a house on rent close to where her relatives stayed. She would visit the relatives regularly.

Only this January did she tell her that often during the visits, the accused would sexually exploit her. He would threaten the victim and warn her against revealing it to anyone, the mother said.

The victim reportedly joined the university in the administrative section in 2009. “The university was within the family and she thought it would be a good idea to work there,” her mother recalled. “My daughter has always been an introvert, and was scared as he was not only her relative but also her boss,” her mother said.

She denies allegation that a property dispute is the reason for her complaint
title: Bengaluru rape victim’s mother seeks justice
